answers.answer: Hi,I am not sure if I have mentioned these previously. A history of repeated instrumentation or surgeries to the area,Peyronie's disease, penile fractures,congenital structural disorders like a micropenis and hypospadias ( urethral opening beneath the shaft).Systemic disease that may affect the kidneys and genitals such as diabetes and hypertension may also cause sexual dysfunction. Stroke and spinal cord disorders that may affect nerves supplying the urologic structures as well as certain medications that may affect the mechanics of erection eg antidepressants and antihypertensives may all contribute to the development of sexual dyfunction.

question: I have 1 more question for you. Here it goes. Are there any urological diseases (that are treated typicly by urologists) except cancers, that can cause severe sexual dysfunctions in men?Thank you
title: Dear Vanessa
